title: Manager, Strategic Partnerships
content:
We’re looking for a partnerships professional to help us accomplish our mission to improve and extend lives by learning from the experience of every person with cancer. Are you ready to be the next changemaker in cancer care?
Flatiron Health is a healthtech company using data for good to power smarter care for every person with cancer, around the world. Flatiron partners with cancer centers in the US, Europe and Asia to transform patients’ real-life experiences into real-world evidence and create a more modern, connected oncology ecosystem. Our multidisciplinary teams include oncologists, data scientists, software engineers, epidemiologists, product experts and more. Flatiron Health is an independent affiliate of the Roche Group.
What You'll Do
Flatiron Health GmbH is hiring a Manager, Strategic Partnerships, to support and accelerate the launch of our business in Germany. You will help build and execute external partnerships and scientific collaborations with a wide range of partners, mainly with hospitals and oncology clinics but also with other players across the German healthcare ecosystem. 
What is required for this job is outstanding interpersonal and analytical skills, strategic thinking, enthusiasm for entrepreneurship, and a passion for tackling the most difficult and complex problems in healthcare. Flatiron is looking for people who are motivated and determined to get the job done in an environment like a fast-paced start-up.

As a part of the Strategic Partnerships Team, support partnership conversations, scoping and execution end-to-end, including meeting preparation, meeting logistics, contract negotiations, etc.
Manage and support execution of partnership implementation, working together with tech, clinical, operational, legal and data privacy teams across Germany and internationally (US, UK, Japan) and own cross-functional development and documentation of processes required for successful implementation of partnerships
Liaise with senior researchers from our partner institutions (e.g. hospitals, pharma) and facilitate development and submission of oncology research proposals, working closely with our clinical and data teams
Organize, moderate and document meetings with external stakeholders and key opinion leaders (e.g. Research Transparency Committee, Advisory Board, etc.)
Support in defining and executing an effective external market positioning and communications approach for Flatiron Health GmbH 
Monitor policy developments around health data, data protection and cancer across Germany and the EU that may impact Flatiron Health GmbH’s approach 
Conduct market research and competitive analyses so as to extract insights to be reflected in Flatiron Health GmbH’s business strategy 
Become an expert on our products and workflows, data users and decision-makers
Recognize ambiguous or undefined problems as opportunities; be intellectually curious and hungry to learn about new areas

Who You Are
You're a kind, passionate and collaborative problem-solver who values the opportunity to think beyond the way things are. In addition, you’re an analytical problem solver with 3 years of experience in management consulting, technology or the pharmaceutical industry.

You are passionate about oncology and learning from health data, and have a background in quantitative research or experience with clinical trials, market access, RWE or outcomes research
You are a strong, analytical problem solver, able to break down ambiguous problems to identify strategic business decisions and their implications
You have strong written and verbal communication skills and enjoy translating a storyline into slides
You are excited about working in a passionate, fast-paced, technology-driven culture and you have an entrepreneurial spirit / “get it done” mentality – you’re able to be flexible in your role and priorities as needed to advance Flatiron’s mission
You are willing to work in our Berlin office
You are fluent in German (minimum requirement C2-level) and English (minimum requirement C1-level)

Extra credit

You have experience in marketing, PR or communications
You have experience developing relationships with key stakeholders and organisations across the German healthcare or technology ecosystem 
You have participated in contract negotiations or are knowledgeable in data protection regulation
You have experience working in a start-up or scale-up environment with product and engineering teams

 
Who We Are
Our people are at the center of everything we do. We strive to foster a culture where our teammates feel equipped and empowered to make meaningful contributions with confidence, compassion, and clarity. Visit the Life at Flatiron page to learn more.

questions.label: How did you hear about this job?
Will you require sponsorship to work now or in the future?
Have you ever worked for Flatiron Health before?
Do you now or have you ever worked for Roche or a Roche subsidiary?
Do you currently work with OncoEMR® (Flatiron’s EHR platform) or any of Flatiron’s Community Oncology products (including OncoBilling®, OncoAnalytics®, or OncoTrials®)?

values.label: Yes, I currently work with OncoEMR or any of Flatiron’s Community Oncology Products.
No, I do NOT work with OncoEMR or any of Flatiron’s Community Oncology Products.

questions.label: Are you able to work within Germany? This role is not eligible to work outside of Germany.
Are you comfortable with Flatiron keeping your resume on file solely for evaluating whether you might be interested in a future opening?
